page.title: 06Buildings in Woburn
page.content: The best known of the buildings in the Village of Woburn is the{Town Hall.} This was designed by the eminent Victorian architect{Edward Blore}(who designed the frontage of Buckingham Palace) on commission to{John 6th Duke {of Bedford}to replace an earlier building demolished in 1830. The Town Hall, built in{gothic}style,is now used for a variety of activities including monthly bingo and a youth club. Blore worked on other commissions for the Duke including rebuilding the church tower. {Staunton House,}which incorporates traditional Dutch Gables, originated from the will of Sir Francis Staunton in 1635. The original almshouses were converted to flatlets for senior citizens in 1968. They are much in demand but priority is given to Woburn residents.
